Summary: Great school for young talented people
Pros: Lazada is a place for great talents thirsty to learn and develop themselves. I have seen people progressing at an incredible speed and getting exposed to various parts of the business. It is also an environment where it matters little how old or experienced you are. If you are good and prove yourself, you can get rewarded quickly. You also have the freedom to try a lot of things on your own.
Cons: While I can say that the majority of the people are very hard working, there are also some (including the senior management) who seem completely misplaced. It is demotivating to see such people tolerated despite contributing close to nothing.

Pros: Good learning and great team
Cons: Aggressive culture focused on numbers

Pros:
There are SOME great employees here who are extremely talented and hard working.
Employees in general are all extremely hard working and passionate
Cons:
Do not trust C level employees of the company. They are artists at manipulation and short term gain.
Having worked for many companies over 12years this company has the most toxic working environment and most short sighted vision I've come across.
The company will work you to the bone and as soon as you show any sign of falling below 120% for a second you will be seen as a weakness with a view for you to leave.This business mentality is a ruthless one so make sure you get the appropriate compensation should you want to work for them.

I think this will change in 1 to 2yrs once the rocket internet culture and hitmen squad have washed away while Lazada brings in its own identity. Until then I'd stay clear.

Pros: Fun Environment, Casual outfit, Good benefit
Cons: Lack of Leadership, Less incremental salary

Pros: A leader in the e-commerce space. Given its short 3 year history, Lazada has impressed with its dominance of the e-commerce industry in SEAsia. I have recently seen new, experienced senior leaders recruited into the team and there apparently is a greater emphasis on Finance, HR, ER and Corporate Governance. There is a sense that the company is shaping up and moving in the right direction. I must say that communication has improved with an increase in the no. of updates from Group CEO as well as the frequency of Townhall mtgs. More development in terms of training and talent mobility. With the recent support of the Breast Cancer Awareness Campaign, it looks like there is a stronger emphasis on CSR initiatives. Great start and looking forward to greater progress in 2016.
Cons:
Difficulty in sourcing for the right candidates as e-commerce is still new in this region.
Can improve more in the area of staff engagement and retention.

Summary: Excellent place for career and personal growth
Pros:
- Work with some of the best thinkers you'll ever meet.
- Young, energetic teams at all levels, who are eager to execute
- Autonomy which allows a certain degree of personalization in execution of high-impact tasks
- Room to take calculated risks, and quickly recover
- Relatively young organization allows for fairly quick career progression.
Cons:
- The fast pace requires resilience and intense focus, may not be for everyone
- Ideas are constantly discussed and challenged, a pliable mind-set required.

Summary: Never leave your current company for Lazada
Pros: Good Salary but also heavy work load
Cons:
No life and work balance.
Bad management, no respect for employee
Bad culture, chaos environment 
Never leave your current company for Lazada, there is no career in there

Pros: Fast pace & dynamics company. If you wish to create the impact & see the result, this is the place to initiate & generate idea & have this launch.
Cons: Need to improve & get everything in process.

Pros: High growth, very interesting challenge
Cons: Problems of internal communication sometimes

Pros: Good opportunities to grow if you are ambitious and not lazy.
Cons: not enough beer on Fridays in the refrigerator...

Pros:
Modern office
Great diversity among employees
Fast-pace, daredevil attitude. Make sure you're able to cope with the speed in this company before applying
Pool of talents
Cons:
Lack of training and improvement programs for employees
Unbalance wage scale between expat and local employees. I understand that the expats need some extra to compensate with living away from their home countries but the difference is ridiculous.

Summary: Do not join this company unless you love to be abuse
Pros:
A good learning ground, fast pace, a good start for fresh grads. 
Lots of talented people to learn from. 
Nice office and pantry. 
As the company is growing need lots of young blood who is willing to learn and spend long hours in offices
Cons:
Verbal abuse is a common thing in this company, it happen daily. 
Long working hours, almost 90% of the people in the company is on 24/7 stand-by. 
The C levels is basically dictators, they are not looking for suggestions and only willing to do things their own way. 
Turn over rate is sky high due to disapproval of management.  
90% of the management came with a consultant background, therefore, all they believe in is numbers and data. They will not look at trends and also market needs.

Pros:
Feels like inventing eCommerce in South East Asia
Super fast growth & super fast pace
Lots of very smart, bright & diverse colleagues
Cons: Sometimes too quick to action, more time to design projects & initiatives would lead to more efficient use of resources

Pros: None - not a good company.
Cons: People get burnt out and are replaced fast.

Pros: Lazada is a great place to learn as you are given a lot of opportunities to own new topics and deliver results in a very short time. Resources are provided to succeed.
Cons: The company is overworking its people and pressure to deliver is high. When employees are showing signs of slowing down the solution is too often to simply replace them, which impedes on the trust that employees have in the company. It is difficult to imagine a long term career at Lazada.

Pros: Fast paced, friendly environment. You will never feel bored. Awesome office, great people.
Cons: Too much overtime. Lately, not enough corporate events.

Pros: Company with huge opportunities and big ambitions
Cons: Fast paced environment sometimes results in high pressure

Pros:
Fast-paced which you can learnt a lot
Great Training ground for fresh grad
Awesome co-workers
Slight higher salary than industry
Cons:
Long working hours without proper compensation, a $10 dinner for OT?
Need to be on standby at midnight cause the developers are monkeys, broke the website all the time
It's easier to climb mount Everest than implement new changes because regional thought they are king
Valuable people are leaving, no loyalty to employees
Micro-managing & Freak out managers, even on weekends.
Keep changing directions, pushing quantity instead of quality.
CEO using profanity on calls and emails.
No respect/Look down on local staff as Caucasian thought they knew everything.
Work/life balance? Don't ever thought about it when you are in the Support Department

Pros: Good salary, good change to learn, the technical community is strong, Bosses are pay attention in technical. You will be proud when you're a staff in here because everyone know Lazada. Free foods, drinks, beer...
Cons: Sometime the job is difficult and messy. The location is District 1, the most expensive district in Saigon, you don't have many option for lunch. HR department is bad, they don't help employee much.

Pros:
- Nice working environment.
- International teams.
- Latest technologies.
- Flexible working hours.
Cons:
- Lack of professional human resources.
- Combination of kitchen and leisure room.

Pros: Good benefits, great and professional environment, nice colleagues, good infrastructure.
Cons: The firm located at center of city so sometime it would heavy traffic jam

Pros:
- Cool Team work, interesting project, flexible schedule.
- Good benefits and chances to promote. Possibility to work with different peoples.
- Suitable for new graduates and people who can work in dynamic environment.
Cons:
- Pressure from Business.
- Used to have Twice-a-year company Trip, but not anymore.
- Compensation still a bit basic in structure. 
- Results driven so you need to on top of your game.

Pros: Working atmosphere is great, colleagues are young and passionate.
Cons: Working space is limited at the old office.

Pros:
- growing industry
- vibrant environment
Cons:
- long hours
- too much showing/reviewing of performance, very little doing/action

Pros: Hard to think of any
Cons:
An absolutely shockingly bad company to work for. Having been brought in to help make LazadaÂ´s own private label  the "next best thing" and make them a substantial fashion brand in SEA. I was promised travel, benefits, joining fashion fairs and so on. But, alas, when something sounds too good to be true, it usually is. 

-The CEO and management were all Caucasian, shouty, arrogant wankers in bright colored shirts or chinos, with lots of money and no respect for anyone that wasn't Caucasian (little advice, if you have a company in Asia, at least give some higher postions to some locals).
-The "travel benefits" were shocking, 30SGD a day for food and drink, which if you know how much money that is, you know its not sufficient enough. We were promised time and time again that this amount would be increased, which it obviously wasn't.
-No cohesiveness between the management and their employees, we were promised that the management were fully behind the fashion team, and that there was no way at all that we should worry for our jobs, and then we were all fired.
-The CEO used to go around shouting and swearing at the top of his voice on his mobile. I'm not fully convinced that he was on his phone, I think that he just did it to intimidate people (which he didn't).

Pros:
I love SellerCenter team in Lazada

We do awesome job on:
- Code quality 
- Scrum management
- Awesome people
- Professional Developers
Cons: - Lunch time is at 12

Summary: dont feel proud to say i'm from lazada
Pros:
- no dress code
- multicultural
Cons:
- no aws & 13th month
- they like to spend big $ to hire expats who know nothing about Asia market, some have never even been to Singapore previously, and because these expats are being paid big $, they think they are all high and mighty
- skin color matters
- higher management are very secretive and you will not know what is going on until they announce

Summary: Not a suitable company to be placed in Malaysia
Pros:
Multiracial
Vibrant workplace
Interesting activities (especially for young adults)

Great flexibility to some department. They give high remuneration and claims on parking and fuel. Get to received personal laptop ( to encourage staff to do work at home ) because they have a lot of workloads to do.
Cons:
Unorganize environment and no work culture
Management spend too much money on hiring expat which doesnt make any good to the company. Sometime they did'nt even know how things work. They did'nt understand how local culture is which is crucial in terms of sales and merchant management. No respects among each other. No distinguish between senior and junior exec. No proper training and such for newbies which is very frustrating to get others kind help. No own cubicle. Work extra hours, most of the time they will start meeting at 6.00pm. They have employee activities during Muslims prayer time, which show no respect to Muslims employee. Get ready to deal with european snobbishness. the worst employer in my 5 years of experience.

Summary: Prejudiced hiring & promoting practice; think carefully what you want out of the experience
Pros: Pioneering e-commerce in Southeast Asia and company raised enough funds to spend/splash around
Cons: Hiring and promoting is very prejudiced and biased towards Europeans from certain background (consulting/banking) and schools. It is very evident that pretty much all the 'management staff' are European/Caucasian, although they are running a business in Southeast Asia. While this practice is somewhat common at Multinationals in the region, this level of stratification and prejudice is unheard of in other similar companies (e.g. think Google, Facebook, or even in Banking or Consulting firms based in the region). The salaries, benefits, career advancement opportunities are different if you are local vs. 'European management.' The management 'move around' to get 'exposures' and vying for the 'next top job' while local staff who quickly realize that there's no long-term advancement here quit after coming to get what they are looking for (e.g. certain experience, building CV etc.). The company is focused on getting the 'next round of funding' fast vs. really building a business for the long-term -- I mean, how many Europeans can  the company import to run the businesses -- and many of them don't speak the language, can't talk to vendor, don't even understand what's on the site, etc. The management generally don't care about building team but getting their own personal advancement (title, team size, fiefdom).

Summary: Good Learning Ground and Good Leadership
Pros:
- Good exposure to a lot of areas. Company is growing very fast and good potential. 
- Good learning ground to understand business as a whole.
- Good leadership skills and guidance
- Basic salary is high but no AWS and 13th month bonus
Cons:
- Long working hours
- Crazy travelling schedules
- Moving so fast thus process is always changing 
- Turnover rate high

Pros:
- Good benefits
- Multi language environment
Cons:
- Lack communication between teams
- Hard to improving skills

Pros:
Learning is fast
multicultural environment
Good pay
Cons:
Long working hour
No SOP
lack of communication between team

Pros: I feeling I must go to the hell every morning. The bad salary
Cons: Just the game in office

Pros: Good office, sometimes nice activities, salary compensation, equipment, interesting project, flexible schedule, possibility to work with different peoples, good opportunity.
Cons: Strange management and priorities, firing in one day, no motivation at all, problem solving. Associating with employees. Management demotivate people. Quality of project.

Pros: Very good learning place, dirty your hand all the time
Cons: Crazy working hours, no fairness

Summary: can be interesting for some time
Pros: decent salary, although not always paid on time, some responsibility and possibility to learn as the company is growing and there is a lot to be done, in many areas.
Cons: no HR, no respect for employees. bureaucratic structure, which is quite a paradox given the 'agile' approach towards work.

Pros:
Pay is absolutely good especially if you're an expats/white. 
Learning curve are pretty steep on your first few months. 
Dynamic and fast culture
Learn how to handle and deal with people who knows how to talk more than action.
Learn how to do fancy presentations
Hired only people from consultancy background or fresh graduate 
Colleagues are pretty fun people
Cons: Worst company management! People are rude, no ethics, politics everywhere. Insults, shouting and personal attack is a norm. Racist especially in recruiting including the top management. Only care about performance but not employee's benefit. Crazy working hours and you're expecting not to leave office on time and work up to 12 hours during peak. No action needed as long as you're good in talking or presenting yourself.  Company culture is racist not multi-racial friendly. Most management are young therefore no leadership skills or people management skills.

Pros: Very fast pace environment all about volume. Great platform which provide exposure to a MNC and flexibility as least beauracracy
Cons: Very young corporation with overwhelming growth rate which back ends of operation struggles to meet in tandem.

Pros:
Itâ€™s a great place to work!  Personnel with the right kind of training and experience are able to share their knowledge and expertise with others all around so as to create a networking and interactive environment. The Company benefits and the staff grow and prosper with the Company as well. Besides that, itâ€™s a great training ground for fresh graduates with innovative ideas and aspirations to glow and grow rapidly. 

Lazada provides the ideal environment for everyone with the right attitude and aptitude, self-driven and focused. In short, it is an environment that motivates me.
Cons: Regular get-together of staff members say, quarterly, provides a meaningful and constructive environment for employeesâ€™ and corporate development. It would provide a platform and a spring-board for staff to engage in. Success is a movement committed to cross pollination of ideas that provides an opportunity for a better way to work, â€˜thinking out of the boxâ€™.

Pros: it is a young and dynamic team. Team culture is active. The flash deal is interesting.
Cons: people are ambitious and not friendly. Base pay is not high compared to sales department in other organization

Summary: Big emerging online marketing within South East Asia region. They are similar to Amazon. More than 1000 employees
Pros: Good salary, no fixed schedule and friendly environment. Suitable for new graduates and people who can work in dynamic environment.
Cons: Good salary but you have to work hard. The office is not well organised. You have no own partition. You have to sit altogether with other employees in the office.

Summary: Fast paced, intense, steep learning curve, as well as super talented and bright people. Great experience so far.
Pros: Growth, autonomy of role, exposure to different functions and general drive of the people who work here. Compensation is good, flexible working hours, international and diverse crowd. Lots of opportunities to move around.
Cons: Pace is fast so communication isn't always there. Compensation still a bit basic in structure. Results driven so you need to on top of your game. A few more perks here and there would be good. Hours can be unpredictable. More formal training would be helpful.

Pros: Great place to learn with the company as it grows, and many opportunities to work with everyone across the board. Everyone's very driven and focused, and it is the kind of environment that motivates me.
Cons: Would be great if employees could get more staff benefits. Everyone works really hard at Lazada (and plays hard too!).

Pros: The company is growing crazily fast and plans are aggressive. It has certainly been an interesting ride that even my own role and responsibility and expanded over the last 3 months.  This is probably a company that you will do 3 years of work in 1, definitely exciting if you are a 'do-er' but certainly not for the faint hearted!  Have seen people who have rotated through different jobs which shows good opportunity and hopefully I can get my chance too.
Cons:
Work-life balance is not great due to the speed of Change. 
Benefits wise may not be holistic but have certainly noted improvements since last year and hope that it will improve further!

Pros:
Challenging work experience
Good team support
Nice view over the city
Cons:
Horrible horrible salary range
Absolutely no respect to employee what so ever
No Transparency in HR Policy.
They won't look for long term commitment with you.

Summary: Worst Company to work for, worst time
Pros: Good salary package, standard benefit
Cons:
- Low morale working environment due to high turnover
- Harsh and political working environment

Pros: This company is undergoing many exciting changes and there are always many opportunities to look forward to. Even if you are not intending to continue in your current field, the company encourages you to rotate around departments. The work itself is fulfilling and encourages you to work beyond your expectations.
Cons: Benefits are still lacking for the moment and there should be more opportunities and resources available for talent development in my opinion. It can also be stressful at times.

Summary: Lazada is a good place to work as a young and enthusiastic professional
Pros:
Young, dynamic working environment.
Learn very fast if you are smart and have the data analysis sense.
Good earning in general
Cons:
Company don't repsect the longterm relationship.
Fast moving, fast firing.
Face with huge amount of work and the feeling of unjust between people in the company

Summary: I will proudly say "I was there"
Pros:
This company is growing fast. I mean really fast!
It give a bunch of experience, carrier opportunities and freedom that mature companies cannot give.
It is very attractive to less experience people, but experienced ones can also find a second breath and challenges to continue learning and growing (my case - 9yrs of experience).
Once approved the timeline between a good idea and it's application is a matter of weeks, days or, even sometimes, hours. And approving (or rejection) doesn't take long...
Very little time is spent on "noneffective work" and it is possible to quickly see the results of the work.

The future looks bright and it is great to picture ourselves in few years time saying "I was there".
Cons:
Constant environment evolution can be both exciting and challenging.
The fast growing pace means that sometimes the job/scope can grow faster than the person and a period of hard work is expected to adjust.
It sometimes can be overwhelming but additional skills learned is also a reward.

Pros: Pay is OK if you're white or if they're scared to lose you. By now nobody cares enough anymore, so you actually get to go home at a decent hour. You might learn something - mostly how not to manage a company and treat people.
Cons:
Culture is totally rotten, starting from the very top. Lots of shouting, insults, personal attacks. Tons of nepotism and favoritism based on family and investor connections. Racial and socioeconomic profiling during the hiring process. Locals max out at the VP level and top management doesn't think they deserve any better, even if performance is top notch. Politics and power games are key factors in all decision-making. People are hired without a need, solely to give extra leverage to their managers ("empire building"). Regional structures are implemented to take power away from local management. Those who stay are usually yes-men or have learned to imitate the "leadership" style at the top. No real dissent is allowed and people who speak their mind are pushed out swiftly. Many others leave on their own. Turnover is huge. New "managers" are sent in every few months. Most employees are frustrated and leave with the first decent offer they receive. 

Do yourself a favor and stay away!

Summary: It's just wrong place to work
Pros: People are the best things here, very talented individuals - you will be enjoy working with the local team here.
Cons:
1) The seats are bad, you will be working on picnic tables.
2) No benefits
3) Very messy - the ratio is 5:1, 5 being people that saying what need to be done and 1 being the person that is actually doing all the requests for those 5

Pros: It's fun getting to work with their different products, they have first Friday parties in the office, HR is very helpful.
Cons: No clear structure when I left, crazy overtime.

Pros: Learn alot and then the learning curve stops
Cons: bad pay. the inner circle gang always find you expendable

Summary: "In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity" - Sun Tzu
Pros:
Great place for someone who thrives on chaos and sees it as an opportunity to create something out of nothing.

The fast-paced life is highly rewarding for someone who loves being in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Friends are made quickly due to the nature of the business and daily interactions.
Cons:
The hours can sometimes be long and taxing, even though it doesn't happen very frequently.
Benefits are OK,  after all this is a start-up environment. 

Lack of open communication at times, and tension among legacy players and newbies - but this is moving in the right direction that is more communication and transparency which allows all parties to fully understand each other.

People who join Lazada should be here for the ride and the exposure to grow and relish the opportunity to be an entrepreneur without having to fork out a hefty investment.

Pros:
- Developed strong analytical skills
- Gained a better understanding of the banking world
- Received Health Insurance
Cons:
Poor working benefits such as;
- No work permit
- Low salary
- Ridiculously long and unhealthy working hours
- Company claimed they paid my taxes, never provided any proof, so I assume it was stolen
- Treated with no respect
- The way you removed all of us from the company has substantially affected my career

Summary: Great Organization but VERY VERY messy
Pros: You get to learn a lot - Co- workers are passionate about their job.
Cons: No matter how hard you work - no appreciation is shown - Title plays a big role in this Organization. No respect shown.

Summary: Terrible management, horrible working hours, no appreciation of employees.
Pros: Good colleagues. Getting to know people you work with is easy as everyone is a friend rather than just a colleague.
Cons: Working hours are horrible, 9am-6pm but you are expected to stay longer. If you come in a few minutes later than 9am, you get a warning letter but no give and take for the fact that you stay till 10pm or later. Management does not care about employee welfare, no benefits, no over time, you work continuously even on weekends, sick days and annual leave. No work-life balance. It feels more like an army camp than a work place. A place where management are bosses rather than leaders. Employee turnover rate is very high, many leave and are replaced with basically anyone who has an education. No real filtering in employment.

Pros:
- friendly and approachable employees
- flexibility in working options (eg. working from home)
- possibility to implement new ideas as it is a set up which welcomes structures
Cons: - limited benefits compared to market, eg. flexi account for various categories such as health screening, gym etc

Pros:
- Casual dressing and flexible arriving time and leaving from office
- Many challenging projects
Cons:
- no entertainment tools in the office
- not very stable

Summary: Bad company culture; hopeless management with no skill & respect; sucks!
Pros: They pay okay. You must ask good pay here to compensate yourself with a stress environment.
Cons:
Bad working culture, no career advancement, bad reputation in industry. 

This company culture sucks. The working environment is unsatisfied and you will not have a future in the company. Never hire a lazadians that were with the company for more than 1 year. You will regret! Those good hire will left the company within 6 months as the longer you stay the faster you will be destroyed by their culture. Ask around the industry or any ex Lazadians who were with the company less than 6 months. 

The old staff is playing office politics and forming small circle in the company which they will reject any new hire and interns at their very best. If you want to join their circle; you have to join them in talking bad things about management or whoever they complained about. They are also good at faking in front of anybody. Office politics is normal for them as they are just a group of unskillful employee looking to protect their job. 

Their management didn't have proper planning or long plan for the company. You won't be surprise if their plan is only 1 day old and it can get cancelled anytime. They just simply hire anybody who has no skills at all because hiring somebody no smarter than themself is a great way to protect their job. You won't be surprise at all if there is director, regional, manager, specialist or executive who has no idea about their job requirement or without any skills.

HR is none the less the worst department which has no respect to other employee. Don't expect HR to help you and they have no system or no proper rules in there. They are just a group of employee that is proud and thinking that they are god who gave you a job. If you want a respect of your talent; never join Lazada Malaysia.

They are hiring people as a worker instead of looking to build a great team. If you are looking for a career, please don't join this company. There is no training in the company and career advancement is none. They will give you fancy title but you are none the less just another worker in the company. You cannot imagine the number of VP or Manager Director or Head or Manager they have in a company. LoL.

Pros: It's good company for young professionals who want to explore the start-up experiences. You will work in multi-nationalities employee. It's fun for those who are workaholic and proactive.
Cons: You life is your work. You hardly have no time after work with friends outside office. High turnover rate. The direction is unclear.

Summary: Probably the worst place to work for
Pros: They apologise for very mistake. Good for individuals who like working in a disorganised environment
Cons:
Highly unprofessional even at the senior level 
Uncommitted to their promise
Disorganised and un respectful of time
In all honesty, a very poor work culture

Pros: The employees are friendly, we often have parties, trips or small talk with each other. The CSR of Lazada is pretty good, you can join in many activites
Cons: The salary is bad, at the beginning they treat us not bad, then the company want to cut down the number of labour so they easily got us fired.
